name: General Self Efficacy Scale Survey
description: The General Self-Efficacy Scale is a 10-item psychometric scale that is designed to assess optimistic self-beliefs to cope with a variety of difficult demands in life.
instructions: For all questions, please choose one of the following.
reference: Schwarzer, R., & Jerusalem, M. (1995). Generalized Self-Efficacy scale. In J. Weinman, S. Wright, & M. Johnston, Measures in health psychology: A userâ€™s portfolio. Causal and control beliefs (pp. 35-37). Windsor, UK: NFER-NELSON.
